1610350298_1yhTF4WKRZsCBdVeh8fwPj14zAiEd.body: Personally I run GNU/Linux (arch), you could try taking a look at QubesOS (which runs everything inside a VM) or TAILS (The Amnesic Incognito Live System; doesn't save any data though). You could also use whonix if you so desire

1610395383_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
> [bimmyql](#comment_46_1yhTF4WKRZsCBdVeh8fwPj14zAiEdtAXW): of course, and that's the best way. but isn't there a concern of "bad actors" (as namvata55 was saying) intentionally trying to conceal CP in downloaded content? seems like for that you'd need a prophylactic instead of just post-hoc blocking. [...]

You can also apply other people's filter lists if you're worried (this one is one I use, but I'm not sure that it's maintained anymore http://localhost:43110/1GPRp2U1kD8A5hZw7Kbctu9x8Bms7zA3tS/, I'm currently making my own to replace it), and if you do accidentally download it of course delete and blacklist it right away. 

Also just don't click on stuff that you don't know where it goes; cp can (admittedly rarely) be found on the clearnet and you can click unmarked links to something bad there too.

And it goes without saying not to click on any links that advertise themselves as CP. Block them, add them to your filter list if you maintain one, and move on.

I guess that hiding it in other content could be a worry, especially as become a peer and upload content again, so it's probably a decent idea to check out what is being downloaded, you can do that from your data folder if you so desire; remember though that if you don't know it's being downloaded chances are whatever blocklists there are might not either, especially if users are allowed to add content to ZeroNet without going through a whitelist/approval process (completely defeating the point of ZeroNet)

1610611550_1ASwoyvUC5DBAECJFQ7WqZVazYdo1.body: That's not a bad point: more ways to sort and search stuff on zerotalk could be a good idea. There are already some (such as kxonet http://localhost:43110/kxonet.bit/?/search/zites, you'll have to go to settings and enable it) which you can enable zerotalk searching on but it would be nice to have something a little more integrated into the zite itself
